newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia money, futures markets closed for holiday.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia money, futures markets closed for holiday.

text.p: The Malaysian interbank money market and interest rates futures market, the Malaysia Monetary Exchange, are closed on Thursday for a national holiday.
On Wednesday, the interbank market closed generally steady due to continued shortage of lenders in the market and bids by finance companies seeking fresh funds.
Dealers said a maturity of Bank Negara bills worth 500 million ringgit on Friday will have little impact as the market was supported at the current levels, partly due to reduced activity.
One-week money was unchanged at 6.8/7.0 percent, two-week at 7.10/20 percent against 7.00/10 on Tuesday and three-week at 7.20/25 percent from 7.10/20.
One-month money at 7.25/30 percent, three-month at 7.30/35 and six-month at 7.35/40, were all unchanged.
Interest rate futures on the Malaysia Monetary Exchange fell back after gains on Tuesday.
The benchmark three-month Kuala Lumpur Interbank Offered Rate (KLIBOR) September contract ended down one point to 92.68, or an implied yield of 7.32 percent.
December and March 1998 were also down one each to 92.67 and 92.60, or 7.33 and 7.40 percent respectively. .
